game.logic

Class StealthGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.logic.StealthGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class StealthGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Main logic class, runs the actual game.
    Author:
    Cameron Bryers 300326848 MMXV, Callum Gill 300316407 2015

    • Method Detail

      • host

        public static StealthGame host(java.lang.String username,
                               int numOfPlayers)
        Host constructor, needs to be parsed a number of players. IP address is defaulted to "localhost".
        Parameters:
        username - - username of the host
        numOfPlayers - - number of players required to start the game
        Returns:
        StealthGame for the host

      • client

        public static StealthGame client(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String ipAddress)
        Client constructor, needs to be parsed an IP address to connect to.
        Parameters:
        username - - username of the client
        ipAddress - - IP address of the host to connect to
        Returns:
        StealthGame for the client

      • start

        public void start()
        Sets up the server/ client and connects client to the server.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Called to stop the game.

      • run

        public void run()
        Main loop that runs the game, due to the nature of the Runnable interface this function is automatically called in the super() constructor.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates the current game state.

        Gets the rendered image of the current scene (as a BufferedImage) and sends it to the main frame.

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(java.lang.String username,
                       double x,
                       double y,
                       double z,
                       double rot)
        Move a player in the world given a 3D vector.
        Parameters:
        username - - username of player to be moved
        x - - player's x coordinate (Tile x, Renderer x)
        y - - player's y coordinate (Tile y, Renderer z)
        z - - player's z coordinate (Tile z, Renderer y)
        rot - - rotation around (z axis -> Tile, y axis -> Renderer)
        See Also:
        GameClient

      • setTeams

        public void setTeams(java.lang.String[] players,
                     java.lang.String[] teams)
        Set teams of the players
        Parameters:
        players - - array of player usernames from the server
        teams - - team allocating, "0" for guard and "1" for spy.
        See Also:
        GameServer

      • handleInteract

        public void handleInteract(java.lang.String username,
                           int ID)
        Handles an interact packet sent from the server. Interactions are then performed by the appropriate player on the appropriate tile.
        Parameters:
        username - - username of the player interacting
        ID - - ID of the tile to interact with
        See Also:
        GameClient

      • handlePickUp

        public void handlePickUp(java.lang.String username,
                         int tileID,
                         int itemID)
        Handles a pickup packet from the server. The level then gives the appropriate player the item parsed in the packet.
        Parameters:
        username - - username of the player picking up the item
        tileID - - ID of the tile that the item was on
        itemID - - ID of the item to be picked up
        See Also:
        GameClient

      • handleDamage

        public void handleDamage(java.lang.String username,
                         double damage)
        Handles a damage packet from the server. The method then gives the appropriate amount of damage to the appropriate player.
        Parameters:
        username - - username of player affected
        damage - - amount of damage to deal
        See Also:
        GameClient
